headerId.title: headerId
headerId.description: headerId of the message. The headerId is defined per topic and incremented by 1 with each sent (but not necessarily received) message.

key.description: The key of the action parameter. For example. duration, direction, signal.

value.description: The value of the action parameter. For example: 103.2, "left", true, [ 1, 2, 3].

x.description: X coordinate described in the world coordinate system.

y.description: Y coordinate described in the world coordinate system.

theta.title: Theta
theta.description:
Orientation of the AGV on the node.
Optional: vehicle can plan the path by itself.
If defined, the AGV has to assume the theta angle on this node.
If previous edge disallows rotation, the AGV is to rotate on the node.
If following edge has a differing orientation defined but disallows rotation, the AGV is to rotate on the node to the edges desired rotation before entering the edge.

allowedDeviationXy.title: allowedDeviationXy
allowedDeviationXy.description:
Indicates how exact an AGV has to drive over a node in order for it to count as traversed.
If = 0: no deviation is allowed (no deviation means within the normal tolerance of the AGV manufacturer).
If > 0: allowed deviation-radius in meters. If the AGV passes a node within the deviation-radius, the node is considered to have been traversed.

allowedDeviationTheta.title: allowedDeviationXy
allowedDeviationTheta.description: Indicates how exact an AGV has to align its orientation with the nodes theta. The value is interpreted as theta+-deviation.nIf = 0: no deviation is allowed (no deviation means within the normal tolerance of the AGV manufacturer).

mapId.title: mapId
mapId.description:
Unique identification of the map in which the position is referenced.
Each map has the same origin of coordinates. When an AGV uses an elevator, e. g. leading from a departure floor to a target floor, it will disappear off the map of the departure floor and spawn in the related lift node on the map of the target floor.

knotVector.description: Sequence of parameter values that determine where and how the control points affect the NURBS curve. knotVector has size of number of control points + degree + 1

controlPoints.description: List of JSON controlPoint objects defining the control points of the NURBS. This includes the start and end point.

x.description: X coordinate described in the world coordinate system.

y.description: Y coordinate described in the world coordinate system.

weight.description:
Range: (0 .. Infinity). The weight with which this control point pulls no the curve.
When not defined, the default will be 1.0.

orientation.description:
Range: [-pi .. pi]. Orientation of the AGV on this position of the curve. The orientation is in world coordinates.
When not defined the orientation of the AGV will be tangential to the curve.

x.description: X-position on the map in reference to the map coordinate system. Precision is up to the specific implementation.

y.description: Y-position on the map in reference to the map coordinate system. Precision is up to the specific implementation.

theta.description:
Range: [-Pi ... Pi]
Orientation of the AGV.

mapId.description:
Unique identification of the map in which the position is referenced.
Each map has the same origin of coordinates. When an AGV uses an elevator, e.g. leading from a departure floor to a target floor, it will disappear off the map of the departure floor and spawn in the related lift node on the map of the target floor.

positionInitialized.description: True if the AGVs position is initialized, false, if position is not initizalized.

localizationScore.description:
Describes the quality of the localization and therefore, can be used e. g. by SLAM-AGVs to describe how accurate the current position information is.
0.0: position unknown
1.0: position known
Optional for vehicles that cannot estimate their localization score.
Only for logging and visualization purposes

deviationRange.description: Value for position deviation range in meters. Can be used if the AGV is able to derive it.

vx.description: The AGVs velocity in its x direction.

vy.description: The AGVs velocity in its y direction.

omega.description: The AGVs turning speed around its z axis.
